bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 25, 1915

div1.p: Blue informs Carter that the Hydro-Electric Company will reimburse his travel expenses.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 25, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 25, 1915.
CD
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to Bureau orders detailing you to make an
investigation of malaria conditions caused by the impounding
of waters in South Carolina, you are informed that the Parr
Shoals Hydro-Electric Company has agreed to reimburse your
traveling expenses, and therefore it will be proper to pre-
sent the bills incurred by you in this connection to the
above mentioned Company for reimbursement.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue.
Surgeon General. Jn3
